content.description: Start on a good sloper and crimp with one foot on a good undercut foot and the right up and flagged. Make a few moves to set up for a large reach out left to an finger diving undercling. Stay tight and work your feet out left. Do a drive-by on a sandy sloper on your way to a two finger pocket. Bump the left to the large dish. Work your feet up and cross the right into a solid but mean fist jam in the back of the maw of the dish. Hit a jug and top out!
content.location:
This is on the large boulder that is uphill of

Joe 97

. The problem is on the pocketed face which faces

Joe 97

. This boulder is also home to the Lizard Head problems which are on the opposite side of The Traveling Fist.

content.description: This problem traverses left on thin crimps along the obvious seam on the West face of the boulder, topping out the open slabby scoop at the end of the seam. The crux is near the end of the seam: a big move left with poor feet from the seam to the large incut edges on the slab. The crimps in the middle are quite thin and somewhat fragile. The footholds at the start will feel hard for taller folks, but the big move at the end will fill harder for shorter people. The grade may be somewhat height/wingspan-dependent.
content.protection: 4 pads do a good job protecting the entire traverse. A spotter is nice for the topout, which, though not a highball, is a bit sporty.
content.location: This is on the West face of the boulder, directly facing the Joe 97 Boulder.

content.description:
Start as for

Peter Parker

, but from the thin crimps at the crux of that route, go straight up over the small roof to the lone, obvious, brown patina flake, and top out. This is just before the big move out left on

Peter Parker

. The move over the roof may be somewhat height-dependent - it's a long reach to the flake.
content.protection: 3 pads and a spotter protect this well.
content.location: It is on the West face of the boulder.

content.description: Start laid back with your left on a low sloper and your right on an undercling beneath the roof.  Throw your right high and right to gain a good crimp.  Pull up to gain the juggy ledge.  Get to the dish the makes the lizard's eye, then top out.
content.location:
This problem starts on the east face of the first big boulder you find off the left of the trial after you pass the Joe 97 boulder. The problem starts uphill from

Crescent Moon

. If you pass the boulder and look back at it from next to Barn Door, it looks like a lizard's head.

content.description: Stand start with you left hand in a shallow, crimpy hueco and your right hand on the corner of the lizard's smile.  Traverse up and right following the ledge that makes the lizard's mouth until you reach the apex of the boulder.  At that point, top out using a huge double-hand glory hold.
content.protection: Pad if you want.  The traverse is low, so you can step off if you somehow manage to get distressed.  The topout is low too.
content.location:
This problem starts on the east face of the first big boulder you find off the left of the trial after you pass the Joe 97 boulder.  The problem starts uphill from

Crescent Moon

.  If you pass the boulder and look back at it from next to Barn Door, it looks like a lizard's head.

content.description: This is a lower variation of the easier route that traverses high up. From a crouch start in the dished out ledge, get a high right foot and a long reach to a pinch. Rock over right, set your hands up with a left on a small sidepull, and work your way up and right on the small crimps and rails that lead you to the apex of the boulder. From here, rocker left and top out with a few slopers.
content.location: This is on the North side of the boulder that the Traveling Fist is on. It has the obvious slopey 1 foot wide ledge at about half-height.

content.description: Start on a couple of slopers low on the left side of the lazy crescent moon-shaped ledge.  Pull across the ledge to the one good hold on the far side.  Top out on more slopers.
content.location: Crescent moon is on the first large boulder on the left hand side of the trail, past Joe 97 boulder.
